page.title: 12Charities in Willingham
page.content: The main charities in the village are the{Willingham Parochial Charities}and the{Josiah Smith Homes,}which were built 19 years ago. The main income is from the letting of land owned by the trust.In 1984 the trust spent about Â£1,100 on maintenance, rates, insurance, etc. There are 14 residents in the homes who are visited daily by a caretaker. The old people are self-sufficient as far as possible although the gardening and some shopping is done for them. {Meals on Wheels}provides cooked meals on some days. Many residents have pets for company. The{Salvation Army,}the{Red Cross}and the{British Legion}also provide help and support for those in need in the village. The{Willingham British School Trust gives grants for educational needs.
